claims.claim: ITER first plasma has been delayed to at least 2033, with full deuterium-tritium operations expected in 2039
ITER's total cost has risen to €18-20 billion, with the July 2024 delay adding an extra €5 billion
NIF achieved 5.2 MJ fusion energy output in February 2024 experiment, with a gain of approximately 2.36
NIF achieved 8.6 MJ yield in April 2025, setting new records for energy yield and target gain
Five ignition shots have been achieved at NIF since December 2022 (Dec 2022, July 2023, Oct 2023 x2, Feb 2024)
Global private investment in fusion has surpassed $9.7-10 billion across approximately 50 projects
Commonwealth Fusion Systems has raised close to $3 billion total, about one-third of all private fusion investment
CFS announced plans for ARC fusion power plant in Chesterfield County, Virginia, expected online in early 2030s with ~400 MW capacity
Google has agreed to purchase 200 MW of fusion power from CFS's planned ARC plant
SPARC tokamak assembly began in 2025, with first plasma expected in 2026 and net power (Q>1) demonstration in 2027
SPARC cryostat base is 24 feet in diameter and weighs 75 tons
SPARC is designed to achieve Q ≈ 11 and up to 140 MW of fusion power for 10-second bursts
Helion Energy has started construction of its 50 MW Orion reactor in Washington state
Helion has a power purchase agreement with Microsoft and $375 million investment from Sam Altman
TAE Technologies has raised over $1.2 billion with a valuation near $5 billion
China's HL-3 tokamak achieved 1 million amperes plasma current in high-confinement mode
China's fusion budget is approximately $1.5 billion per year, nearly double the US government allocation
CFETR (China Fusion Engineering Test Reactor) expected to begin construction by late 2020s, operational in 2030s
China's EAST tokamak achieved 101-second H-mode discharge, leading in long-pulse operation
French WEST tokamak maintained hydrogen plasma for over 20 minutes with 2 MW heating power
University of Wisconsin's WHAM experiment achieved 17 Tesla magnetic field, strongest ever for such a device
NRC will regulate fusion under byproduct material framework, separating it from fission regulation (ADVANCE Act 2024)
NRC proposed rule for fusion regulation scheduled for Federal Register publication May 28, 2025
Over 160 fusion facilities are operational, under construction, or planned globally
UK government announced £2.5 billion investment in fusion over five years
Fusion Industry Association has 45 members who have collectively raised over $7 billion
MIT modeling shows fusion could reach 10-50% of electricity generation by 2100 depending on cost scenarios
Chinese AI research achieved plasma parameter measurements 10x faster than traditional methods
